info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 18 at 9:39AM CDT until March 19 at 12:20AM CDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Green River near Mammoth Cave affecting Edmonson County.
Green River at Woodbury affecting Butler and Warren Counties.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Green River at Rochester affecting Ohio, Muhlenberg and Butler Counties.
.Heavy rain from the past weekend has caused the river to rise.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Green River near Mammoth Cave.
* WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Green River Ferry closes to RV and trailer traffic due to high water. Heavy loads will be at the judgment of the ferry operator considering the 12 ton load limit of ferry. Backcountry camping on the Green River floodplain is prohibited. At 20.1 feet, Launching of paddle craft is prohibited. At 32.0 feet, Green River Ferry closes to all traffic due to high water.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 36.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CDT Tuesday was 38.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 20.5 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 32.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 34.6 feet on 02/12/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 1230 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT
